Definition: the edge or selvedge of any cloth
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LIST: The edge or selvedge of any cloth
text: LIST: The edge or selvedge of any cloth

Definition: a super quality cloth used for shirtings and blouses, made from a union warp and weft containing from 50 to 80 per cent. wool in both. about 44 to 50 ends and picks per inch, and 16's to 20's warp, 12's to 18's weft (worsted counts). made plain, twill, and in stripes.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LLAMA SHIRTING: A super quality cloth used for shirtings and blouses, made from a union warp and weft containing from 50 to 80 per cent. wool in both. About 44 to 50 ends and picks per inch, and 16's to 20's warp, 12's to 18's weft (worsted counts). Made plain, twill, and in stripes.
text: LLAMA SHIRTING: A super quality cloth used for shirtings and blouses, made from a union warp and weft containing from 50 to 80 per cent. wool in both. About 44 to 50 ends and picks per inch, and 16's to 20's warp, 12's to 18's weft (worsted counts). Made plain, twill, and in stripes.

Definition: a term used to imply that artificial weighting has been put into a cloth, such as starch, china clay, dextrine, magnesium chloride, etc.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LOADING: A term used to imply that artificial weighting has been put into a cloth, such as starch, china clay, dextrine, magnesium chloride, etc.
text: LOADING: A term used to imply that artificial weighting has been put into a cloth, such as starch, china clay, dextrine, magnesium chloride, etc.

Definition: the dry cloth to be shrunk is folded between an upper and lower layer of wet cloth. the cloth is then dried naturally, and afterwards pressed by cold hydraulic power. different finishers make their own variations and additions in order to get a pure soft handle with a deader appearance than the fabric has before treatment.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LONDON SHRUNK (WOOLLEN PROCESS): The dry cloth to be shrunk is folded between an upper and lower layer of wet cloth. The cloth is then dried naturally, and afterwards pressed by cold hydraulic power. Different finishers make their own variations and additions in order to get a pure soft handle with a deader appearance than the fabric has before treatment.
text: LONDON SHRUNK (WOOLLEN PROCESS): The dry cloth to be shrunk is folded between an upper and lower layer of wet cloth. The cloth is then dried naturally, and afterwards pressed by cold hydraulic power. Different finishers make their own variations and additions in order to get a pure soft handle with a deader appearance than the fabric has before treatment.

Definition: a plain or twill cloth used for underwear purposes, bleached and pure finish. usually 34 in. to 36 in., 36 yards long, and about 60 by 60 ends and picks, 30's and 30's. all particulars differ in various makes. made for home trade, and export to india, china, etc. the original longcloth was a very fine one, and made from 60's/40's to 80's/60's super yarns and 96 by 90 ends and picks.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LONGCLOTH: A plain or twill cloth used for underwear purposes, bleached and pure finish. Usually 34 in. to 36 in., 36 yards long, and about 60 by 60 ends and picks, 30's and 30's. All particulars differ in various makes. Made for home trade, and export to India, China, etc. The original longcloth was a very fine one, and made from 60's/40's to 80's/60's super yarns and 96 by 90 ends and picks.
text: LONGCLOTH: A plain or twill cloth used for underwear purposes, bleached and pure finish. Usually 34 in. to 36 in., 36 yards long, and about 60 by 60 ends and picks, 30's and 30's. All particulars differ in various makes. Made for home trade, and export to India, China, etc. The original longcloth was a very fine one, and made from 60's/40's to 80's/60's super yarns and 96 by 90 ends and picks.

Definition: an all-wool fabric of the four-end twill weave, usually 30 in. by 24 yards, bright red dyed, calender finish. a yorkshire production.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LONG ENDS: An all-wool fabric of the four-end twill weave, usually 30 in. by 24 yards, bright red dyed, calender finish. A Yorkshire production.
text: LONG ENDS: An all-wool fabric of the four-end twill weave, usually 30 in. by 24 yards, bright red dyed, calender finish. A Yorkshire production.

Definition: a constant number which governs the change wheel of a loom. when the dividend is divided by the picks re- quired per quarter inch the quotient gives the number of teeth required in the change wheel to give that pick in the cloth. ¬¶
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LOOM DIVIDEND: A constant number which governs the change wheel of a loom. When the dividend is divided by the picks re- quired per quarter inch the quotient gives the number of teeth required in the change wheel to give that pick in the cloth. ¬¶
text: LOOM DIVIDEND: A constant number which governs the change wheel of a loom. When the dividend is divided by the picks re- quired per quarter inch the quotient gives the number of teeth required in the change wheel to give that pick in the cloth. ¬¶

Definition: the operation of drawing the warp ends through the healds and reed which will be placed in the loom.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LOOMING: The operation of drawing the warp ends through the healds and reed which will be placed in the loom.
text: LOOMING: The operation of drawing the warp ends through the healds and reed which will be placed in the loom.

Definition: when a shuttle fails to enter the box there must be some arrangement to stop the loom, or a serious smash will occur through the shuttle being in the shed. in the fast reed loom this is done by means of a stop-rod and tongue coming into contact with the shoulder of the frog at the front of the loom. when the shuttle is in its box this tongue is lifted out of the way of the frog. this type of loom is used for slow running and the bulk of the lancashire trade. with the loose reed loom, when the shuttle is trapped in the shed or fails to reach its box the reed is pushed out of its position, and the loom stops. best suited for light goods and fast running looms.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LOOMS, FAST AND LOOSE REED: When a shuttle fails to enter the box there must be some arrangement to stop the loom, or a serious smash will occur through the shuttle being in the shed. In the fast reed loom this is done by means of a stop-rod and tongue coming into contact with the shoulder of the frog at the front of the loom. When the shuttle is in its box this tongue is lifted out of the way of the frog. This type of loom is used for slow running and the bulk of the Lancashire trade. With the loose reed loom, when the shuttle is trapped in the shed or fails to reach its box the reed is pushed out of its position, and the loom stops. Best suited for light goods and fast running looms.
text: LOOMS, FAST AND LOOSE REED: When a shuttle fails to enter the box there must be some arrangement to stop the loom, or a serious smash will occur through the shuttle being in the shed. In the fast reed loom this is done by means of a stop-rod and tongue coming into contact with the shoulder of the frog at the front of the loom. When the shuttle is in its box this tongue is lifted out of the way of the frog. This type of loom is used for slow running and the bulk of the Lancashire trade. With the loose reed loom, when the shuttle is trapped in the shed or fails to reach its box the reed is pushed out of its position, and the loom stops. Best suited for light goods and fast running looms.

Definition: the indian cloth is generally 23 in. finished width and 4 yds. long. the natives cut them into two, and stitch the two pieces together side by side. the african style is 32 in. to 40 in. wide and of several lengths from 2 yards upwards. both styles are checks, rather broad, and of several colours, with a broad border at one selvedge. the border is all one colour and crammed in the reed. the cloth is used for men's dress. loose-back toilet (see toilets)- this style of toilet fabric is inferior to the usual one. the figuring is formed by the stitching back yarn being loose, which causes the face cloth to be raised. they are woven on jacquard looms with healds in front.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LOONGYES, LOONGIES, LUNGIS: The Indian cloth is generally 23 in. finished width and 4 yds. long. The natives cut them into two, and stitch the two pieces together side by side. The African style is 32 in. to 40 in. wide and of several lengths from 2 yards upwards. Both styles are checks, rather broad, and of several colours, with a broad border at one selvedge. The border is all one colour and crammed in the reed. The cloth is used for men's dress. LOOSE-BACK TOILET (See TOILETS)- This style of toilet fabric is inferior to the usual one. The figuring is formed by the stitching back yarn being loose, which causes the face cloth to be raised. They are woven on jacquard looms with healds in front.
text: LOONGYES, LOONGIES, LUNGIS: The Indian cloth is generally 23 in. finished width and 4 yds. long. The natives cut them into two, and stitch the two pieces together side by side. The African style is 32 in. to 40 in. wide and of several lengths from 2 yards upwards. Both styles are checks, rather broad, and of several colours, with a broad border at one selvedge. The border is all one colour and crammed in the reed. The cloth is used for men's dress. LOOSE-BACK TOILET (See TOILETS)- This style of toilet fabric is inferior to the usual one. The figuring is formed by the stitching back yarn being loose, which causes the face cloth to be raised. They are woven on jacquard looms with healds in front.

Definition: a very fine silk fabric shipped to china; crepe weave, and in many widths and qualities.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LOUISINE: A very fine silk fabric shipped to China; crepe weave, and in many widths and qualities.
text: LOUISINE: A very fine silk fabric shipped to China; crepe weave, and in many widths and qualities.

Definition: a twofold cotton warp dress fabric, plain weave, with mohair weft of rather coarse counts. the warp is yarn- dyed and the cloth cross-dyed. during the finishing pro- cess the weft is thrown to the surface, entirely covering the warp by reason of the warp being pulled straight and the weft bending. this bending of the weft gives the lustre. all cotton cloths sold as lustres are a very poor imita- tion. they are woven from a bleached warp about 2/40's and a soft spun dyed weft about 12's. as many picks as possible are put in.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LUSTRES, LUSTRE DRESS FABRIC: A twofold cotton warp dress fabric, plain weave, with mohair weft of rather coarse counts. The warp is yarn- dyed and the cloth cross-dyed. During the finishing pro- cess the weft is thrown to the surface, entirely covering the warp by reason of the warp being pulled straight and the weft bending. This bending of the weft gives the lustre. All cotton cloths sold as lustres are a very poor imita- tion. They are woven from a bleached warp about 2/40's and a soft spun dyed weft about 12's. As many picks as possible are put in.
text: LUSTRES, LUSTRE DRESS FABRIC: A twofold cotton warp dress fabric, plain weave, with mohair weft of rather coarse counts. The warp is yarn- dyed and the cloth cross-dyed. During the finishing pro- cess the weft is thrown to the surface, entirely covering the warp by reason of the warp being pulled straight and the weft bending. This bending of the weft gives the lustre. All cotton cloths sold as lustres are a very poor imita- tion. They are woven from a bleached warp about 2/40's and a soft spun dyed weft about 12's. As many picks as possible are put in.

Definition: this is a name used principally by french traders for the alpaca fabric.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LUSTRE ORLEANS: This is a name used principally by French traders for the alpaca fabric.
text: LUSTRE ORLEANS: This is a name used principally by French traders for the alpaca fabric.

Definition: french imitation of the japanese pongee, and at best a rather poor one.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LYONNESSE PONGEES: French imitation of the Japanese Pongee, and at best a rather poor one.
text: LYONNESSE PONGEES: French imitation of the Japanese Pongee, and at best a rather poor one.

Definition: a fast pile heavy velvet with a ground weave based on the 3 by 1 warp twill, but repeated on six picks. the loops are formed by the use of wires‚äîthere are three picks between each wire, which bind the pile ends very firmly, and two ground ends are used to one pile end. all the pile ends are raised over each wire. the cloth is prin- cipally woven on the continent.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: LYONS VELVET: A fast pile heavy velvet with a ground weave based on the 3 by 1 warp twill, but repeated on six picks. The loops are formed by the use of wires‚Äîthere are three picks between each wire, which bind the pile ends very firmly, and two ground ends are used to one pile end. All the pile ends are raised over each wire. The cloth is prin- cipally woven on the continent.
text: LYONS VELVET: A fast pile heavy velvet with a ground weave based on the 3 by 1 warp twill, but repeated on six picks. The loops are formed by the use of wires‚Äîthere are three picks between each wire, which bind the pile ends very firmly, and two ground ends are used to one pile end. All the pile ends are raised over each wire. The cloth is prin- cipally woven on the continent.

Definition: a plain weave cloth made for south america in small check designs of bright colours; shipped in a soft finish; 26 in. wide, 72 by 76, 26's/8's; the warp is woven two ends together. also made 48 by 76, 2/18's/8's, one end in a dent. a home trade cloth sold under this name, also in small checks of bright colours, is made in various widths and qualities, one of which is 29 in., 96 by 96, 32/32. this is also shipped to china.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MACANA CHECKS: A plain weave cloth made for South America in small check designs of bright colours; shipped in a soft finish; 26 in. wide, 72 by 76, 26's/8's; the warp is woven two ends together. Also made 48 by 76, 2/18's/8's, one end in a dent. A home trade cloth sold under this name, also in small checks of bright colours, is made in various widths and qualities, one of which is 29 in., 96 by 96, 32/32. This is also shipped to China.
text: MACANA CHECKS: A plain weave cloth made for South America in small check designs of bright colours; shipped in a soft finish; 26 in. wide, 72 by 76, 26's/8's; the warp is woven two ends together. Also made 48 by 76, 2/18's/8's, one end in a dent. A home trade cloth sold under this name, also in small checks of bright colours, is made in various widths and qualities, one of which is 29 in., 96 by 96, 32/32. This is also shipped to China.

Definition: a very light weight shirting fabric, plain weave, with narrow coloured warp stripes in either silk or mercerised cotton. usually made from very good quality yarns, such as 60's/60's, both egyptian, and 2/120's mercerised stripes, in widths 27 in. to 34 in. and 52 in. many cloths are sold as 'madras," but the above described is the only true one.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MADRAS: A very light weight shirting fabric, plain weave, with narrow coloured warp stripes in either silk or mercerised cotton. Usually made from very good quality yarns, such as 60's/60's, both Egyptian, and 2/120's mercerised stripes, in widths 27 in. to 34 in. and 52 in. Many cloths are sold as 'Madras," but the above described is the only true one.
text: MADRAS: A very light weight shirting fabric, plain weave, with narrow coloured warp stripes in either silk or mercerised cotton. Many cloths are sold as 'Madras," but the above described is the only true one.

Definition: very similar in yarns to madras, but with much more colour, as much as 75 per cent. of colour in the stripes and 50 per cent. colour with checks. used for fine shirt- ings, blouses, and children's wear.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MADRAS GINGHAM: Very similar in yarns to Madras, but with much more colour, as much as 75 per cent. of colour in the stripes and 50 per cent. colour with checks. Used for fine shirt- ings, blouses, and children's wear.
text: MADRAS GINGHAM: Very similar in yarns to Madras, but with much more colour, as much as 75 per cent. of colour in the stripes and 50 per cent. colour with checks. Used for fine shirt- ings, blouses, and children's wear.

Definition: a plain weave check cloth woven from yarns dyed with a loose top, which during finishing bleeds off and stains the cloth. also known as bleeding checks.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MADRAS HANDKERCHIEFS: A plain weave check cloth woven from yarns dyed with a loose top, which during finishing bleeds off and stains the cloth. Also known as Bleeding Checks.
text: MADRAS HANDKERCHIEFS: A plain weave check cloth woven from yarns dyed with a loose top, which during finishing bleeds off and stains the cloth. Also known as Bleeding Checks.

Definition: a heavy sized plain grey cloth, shipped unfinished. usually 36 in., 34 to 36 yards, with a broad heading of magenta coloured yarn at one or both ends. about 60 by 64 ends and picks, 32's/30's yarn.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MAGENTA GREYS: A heavy sized plain grey cloth, shipped unfinished. Usually 36 in., 34 to 36 yards, with a broad heading of magenta coloured yarn at one or both ends. About 60 by 64 ends and picks, 32's/30's yarn.
text: MAGENTA GREYS: A heavy sized plain grey cloth, shipped unfinished. Usually 36 in., 34 to 36 yards, with a broad heading of magenta coloured yarn at one or both ends. About 60 by 64 ends and picks, 32's/30's yarn.

Definition: the silk trade term for a tulle silk fabric. made from very fine silk yarns and in a gauze weave.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MALINE: The silk trade term for a tulle silk fabric. Made from very fine silk yarns and in a gauze weave.
text: MALINE: The silk trade term for a tulle silk fabric. Made from very fine silk yarns and in a gauze weave.

Definition: a brazilian grown cotton with a good staple, harsh to the feel, wiry, and is a fair cotton for bleaching cloths. will spin into yarns up to 50's.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MARANHAM COTTON: A Brazilian grown cotton with a good staple, harsh to the feel, wiry, and is a fair cotton for bleaching cloths. Will spin into yarns up to 50's.
text: MARANHAM COTTON: A Brazilian grown cotton with a good staple, harsh to the feel, wiry, and is a fair cotton for bleaching cloths. Will spin into yarns up to 50's.

Definition: a woollen fancy yarn produced from differently coloured rovings. the rovings are so blended that the finished yarn has the appearance of having been made from two differently coloured threads twisted together.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MARLS: A woollen fancy yarn produced from differently coloured rovings. The rovings are so blended that the finished yarn has the appearance of having been made from two differently coloured threads twisted together.
text: MARLS: A woollen fancy yarn produced from differently coloured rovings. The rovings are so blended that the finished yarn has the appearance of having been made from two differently coloured threads twisted together.

Definition: a plain cloth, low in reed and pick, resembling a voile. a sample cloth is 40 in. wide, 44 by 48 ends and picks, 60's/60's, both hard twisted, one in a dent.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MARQUISETTE: A plain cloth, low in reed and pick, resembling a voile. A sample cloth is 40 in. wide, 44 by 48 ends and picks, 60's/60's, both hard twisted, one in a dent.
text: MARQUISETTE: A plain cloth, low in reed and pick, resembling a voile. A sample cloth is 40 in. wide, 44 by 48 ends and picks, 60's/60's, both hard twisted, one in a dent.

Definition: a compound fabric consisting of two plain cloths joined together by stitches, so arranged as to produce a pattern. between the two cloths are inserted wadding weft of coarse yarn. a jacquard machine and heald shafts are required to weave the cloth. three-quarters of the warp threads are drawn only on the healds, and the re- mainder through the harness. each card serves for ten picks, viz., four picks of fine weft for face cloth, four from same shuttle for back cloth, and two picks of coarse weft for wadding. the jacquard controls pattern and the stitching of the two cloths together. the cloth can be woven from one beam, but two beams allow the tension on the stitching threads to be more regular. this cloth is an imitation of an eastern fabric used as quilts, and made from a pure plain woven cloth, two pieces of this cloth being placed together, one on the top of the other, and a thick wadding placed between, the whole being stitched together by hand. where no stitches were used the cloth bulged owing to the wadding between.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MARSEILLE QUILTS: A compound fabric consisting of two plain cloths joined together by stitches, so arranged as to produce a pattern. Between the two cloths are inserted wadding weft of coarse yarn. A jacquard machine and heald shafts are required to weave the cloth. Three-quarters of the warp threads are drawn only on the healds, and the re- mainder through the harness. Each card serves for ten picks, viz., four picks of fine weft for face cloth, four from same shuttle for back cloth, and two picks of coarse weft for wadding. The jacquard controls pattern and the stitching of the two cloths together. The cloth can be woven from one beam, but two beams allow the tension on the stitching threads to be more regular. This cloth is an imitation of an Eastern fabric used as quilts, and made from a pure plain woven cloth, two pieces of this cloth being placed together, one on the top of the other, and a thick wadding placed between, the whole being stitched together by hand. Where no stitches were used the cloth bulged owing to the wadding between.
text: MARSEILLE QUILTS: A compound fabric consisting of two plain cloths joined together by stitches, so arranged as to produce a pattern. Between the two cloths are inserted wadding weft of coarse yarn. A jacquard machine and heald shafts are required to weave the cloth. Three-quarters of the warp threads are drawn only on the healds, and the re- mainder through the harness. Each card serves for ten picks, viz., four picks of fine weft for face cloth, four from same shuttle for back cloth, and two picks of coarse weft for wadding. The jacquard controls pattern and the stitching of the two cloths together. The cloth can be woven from one beam, but two beams allow the tension on the stitching threads to be more regular. This cloth is an imitation of an Eastern fabric used as quilts, and made from a pure plain woven cloth, two pieces of this cloth being placed together, one on the top of the other, and a thick wadding placed between, the whole being stitched together by hand. Where no stitches were used the cloth bulged owing to the wadding between.

Definition: a nainsook style of fabric, but finished with a moire or watered silk face.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MASALIA: A nainsook style of fabric, but finished with a moire or watered silk face.
text: MASALIA: A nainsook style of fabric, but finished with a moire or watered silk face.

Definition: a double or compound cloth used for vestings, mantles, etc. the figuring is developed by a variety of weaves, and is really a brocade face cloth. wadding weft is used to give a raised appearance. this cloth differs from quilt- ings by having a brocade face with irregular floats. whole of the warp, both face and back, is controlled by the jacquard. cotton matelasse is usually two face, one back, both warp and weft, and the silk and wool varieties one face one back. the
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MATELASSE: A double or compound cloth used for vestings, mantles, etc. The figuring is developed by a variety of weaves, and is really a brocade face cloth. Wadding weft is used to give a raised appearance. This cloth differs from quilt- ings by having a brocade face with irregular floats. whole of the warp, both face and back, is controlled by the jacquard. Cotton matelasse is usually two face, one back, both warp and weft, and the silk and wool varieties one face one back. The

Definition: fabrics in which one or both series of threads work two or more ends or picks together: such as 2 √ó 2, 3 x 3, or 4 x 4 ends and picks, and these are known as 2 x 2, 3 x 3, or 4 x 4 matts. the weave is plain and yarns coarse, such as 24's/18's.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MATTS: Fabrics in which one or both series of threads work two or more ends or picks together: such as 2 √ó 2, 3 x 3, or 4 x 4 ends and picks, and these are known as 2 x 2, 3 x 3, or 4 x 4 matts. The weave is plain and yarns coarse, such as 24's/18's.
text: MATTS: Fabrics in which one or both series of threads work two or more ends or picks together: such as 2 √ó 2, 3 x 3, or 4 x 4 ends and picks, and these are known as 2 x 2, 3 x 3, or 4 x 4 matts. The weave is plain and yarns coarse, such as 24's/18's.

Definition: the weaves used for matting cloth, such as canvas, matt shirtings, etc. generally the 2 x 2 is used, but fancy dobby effects are introduced for variety.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MATT WEAVES: The weaves used for matting cloth, such as canvas, matt shirtings, etc. Generally the 2 x 2 is used, but fancy dobby effects are introduced for variety.
text: MATT WEAVES: The weaves used for matting cloth, such as canvas, matt shirtings, etc. Generally the 2 x 2 is used, but fancy dobby effects are introduced for variety.

Definition: an 8-end twill weave used principally for wool and worsted fabrics.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MAYO TWILL (See CAMPBELL TWILL)‚: Äî An 8-end twill weave used principally for wool and worsted fabrics.
text: MAYO TWILL (See CAMPBELL TWILL)‚: Äî An 8-end twill weave used principally for wool and worsted fabrics.

Definition: a sized grey cloth of medium quality, very similar to domestics or sized shirtings.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MEDIUMS: A sized grey cloth of medium quality, very similar to domestics or sized shirtings.
text: MEDIUMS: A sized grey cloth of medium quality, very similar to domestics or sized shirtings.

Definition: cotton cloths woven in dobby looms on 10 shafts, with stripes formed by reversing the 5-end satin, such as 20 ends 4 x 1 weave, the next 20 ends being 1 x 4 weave, quality about 72 √ó 68 36's/42's.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MEDIUM STRIPES: Cotton cloths woven in dobby looms on 10 shafts, with stripes formed by reversing the 5-end satin, such as 20 ends 4 x 1 weave, the next 20 ends being 1 x 4 weave, quality about 72 √ó 68 36's/42's.

Definition: a fancy worsted yarn made from a printed sliver. during spinning the colour is mixed. usually more than one colour is printed on the sliver in bands.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MELANGE: A fancy worsted yarn made from a printed sliver. During spinning the colour is mixed. Usually more than one colour is printed on the sliver in bands.
text: MELANGE: A fancy worsted yarn made from a printed sliver. During spinning the colour is mixed. Usually more than one colour is printed on the sliver in bands.

Definition: a heavy cord cloth, all cotton, made on 8 shafts and 20 picks to a repeat, 31 in. wide, and weighing 60 to 70 lb. for 98 yards. yarns about 14's and 16's.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MELLOR'S UNION CORD: A heavy cord cloth, all cotton, made on 8 shafts and 20 picks to a repeat, 31 in. wide, and weighing 60 to 70 lb. for 98 yards. Yarns about 14's and 16's.
text: MELLOR'S UNION CORD: A heavy cord cloth, all cotton, made on 8 shafts and 20 picks to a repeat, 31 in. wide, and weighing 60 to 70 lb. for 98 yards. Yarns about 14's and 16's.

Definition: a heavy smooth woollen cloth made from a cotton warp and wool weft. warp usually weaving matting; 50 to 56 in. wide and about 24 oz. per yard. very heavily milled, and the cloth is raised and cropped.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MELTON: A heavy smooth woollen cloth made from a cotton warp and wool weft. Warp usually weaving matting; 50 to 56 in. wide and about 24 oz. per yard. Very heavily milled, and the cloth is raised and cropped.
text: MELTON: A heavy smooth woollen cloth made from a cotton warp and wool weft. Warp usually weaving matting; 50 to 56 in. wide and about 24 oz. per yard. Very heavily milled, and the cloth is raised and cropped.

Definition: a thread that gives an appearance of silk, and is made by treating cotton yarn under tension with caustic soda. this yarn is lustrous, and can be dyed in very beautiful shades.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MERCERISED COTTON: A thread that gives an appearance of silk, and is made by treating cotton yarn under tension with caustic soda. This yarn is lustrous, and can be dyed in very beautiful shades.
text: MERCERISED COTTON: A thread that gives an appearance of silk, and is made by treating cotton yarn under tension with caustic soda. This yarn is lustrous, and can be dyed in very beautiful shades.

Definition: a process to increase the lustre of cotton, and is based upon the fact that cotton fibre steeped in cold concen- trated caustic soda loses its twisted tape-like form, and becomes round and partly transparent, and when treated under tension a good lustre is developed. cloth or yarn can be mercerised.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MERCERISING: A process to increase the lustre of cotton, and is based upon the fact that cotton fibre steeped in cold concen- trated caustic soda loses its twisted tape-like form, and becomes round and partly transparent, and when treated under tension a good lustre is developed. Cloth or yarn can be mercerised.
text: MERCERISING: A process to increase the lustre of cotton, and is based upon the fact that cotton fibre steeped in cold concen- trated caustic soda loses its twisted tape-like form, and becomes round and partly transparent, and when treated under tension a good lustre is developed. Cloth or yarn can be mercerised.

Definition: the merino sheep gives the finest of all wools up to 80's counts, which is very soft and white. the original merino fabric was woven from this wool, but now many so-called merinoes have no trace of the merino wool. an all-wool fabric, with a twill face and back, dyed in colours, and variously made 25 to 27 inches from 64 x 36 to 120 √ó 96 ends and picks, 30's to 36's warp and 40's to 44's weft.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MERINOES: The merino sheep gives the finest of all wools up to 80's counts, which is very soft and white. The original merino fabric was woven from this wool, but now many so-called merinoes have no trace of the merino wool. An all-wool fabric, with a twill face and back, dyed in colours, and variously made 25 to 27 inches from 64 x 36 to 120 √ó 96 ends and picks, 30's to 36's warp and 40's to 44's weft.
text: MERINOES: The merino sheep gives the finest of all wools up to 80's counts, which is very soft and white. The original merino fabric was woven from this wool, but now many so-called merinoes have no trace of the merino wool. An all-wool fabric, with a twill face and back, dyed in colours, and variously made 25 to 27 inches from 64 x 36 to 120 √ó 96 ends and picks, 30's to 36's warp and 40's to 44's weft.

Definition: the french measure of length, and is equivalent to 39.37079 inches.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: METRE: The French measure of length, and is equivalent to 39.37079 inches.
text: METRE: The French measure of length, and is equivalent to 39.37079 inches.

Definition: a sized grey cotton cloth, plain weave, 32 to 36 in. wide, 24 yards long, 18 x 18 ends and picks per inch, 24's/20's warp and weft.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MEXICANS: A sized grey cotton cloth, plain weave, 32 to 36 in. wide, 24 yards long, 18 x 18 ends and picks per inch, 24's/20's warp and weft.
text: MEXICANS: A sized grey cotton cloth, plain weave, 32 to 36 in. wide, 24 yards long, 18 x 18 ends and picks per inch, 24's/20's warp and weft.

Definition: a fungoid growth caused by fermentation set up by moisture and heat. whenever wet or damp material lies for any length of time in a warm temperature the best conditions for mildew development are obtained. this is frequently seen where pieces of cloth are piled in heaps, when the pressure prevents the air circulating and causes heat. sized goods are the most troublesome, especially medium or heavy sized. pure sized cloths are very seldom attacked.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MILDEW: A fungoid growth caused by fermentation set up by moisture and heat. Whenever wet or damp material lies for any length of time in a warm temperature the best conditions for mildew development are obtained. This is frequently seen where pieces of cloth are piled in heaps, when the pressure prevents the air circulating and causes heat. Sized goods are the most troublesome, especially medium or heavy sized. Pure sized cloths are very seldom attacked.
text: MILDEW: A fungoid growth caused by fermentation set up by moisture and heat. Whenever wet or damp material lies for any length of time in a warm temperature the best conditions for mildew development are obtained. This is frequently seen where pieces of cloth are piled in heaps, when the pressure prevents the air circulating and causes heat. Sized goods are the most troublesome, especially medium or heavy sized. Pure sized cloths are very seldom attacked.

Definition: cotton cloths which have been through a patent pro- cess known as "millerainising." this is a system of hot pressing. the patentees claim that the fabrics thus treated do not shrink or cockle in washing, do not lose their shape or smoothness, and that damp, dust, and street dirt can be easily removed.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MILLERAINISED FABRICS: Cotton cloths which have been through a patent pro- cess known as "millerainising." This is a system of hot pressing. The patentees claim that the fabrics thus treated do not shrink or cockle in washing, do not lose their shape or smoothness, and that damp, dust, and street dirt can be easily removed.
text: MILLERAINISED FABRICS: Cotton cloths which have been through a patent pro- cess known as "millerainising." This is a system of hot pressing. The patentees claim that the fabrics thus treated do not shrink or cockle in washing, do not lose their shape or smoothness, and that damp, dust, and street dirt can be easily removed.

Definition: a silk term for a warp rib fabric.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MILLERAYES: A silk term for a warp rib fabric.
text: MILLERAYES: A silk term for a warp rib fabric.

Definition: a quilt woven on a jacquard loom with the use of healds. it is a double cloth, composed of two plains cloths very firmly interwoven. the design is made by the two cloths interchanging. the bulk of these quilts are woven from all grey yarns, and bleached afterwards, but colour is sometimes used for the ground effects with the figure shew- ing in white. many qualities are sold, and an average sample is 18's/36's for ground, with 36's/8's or 10's for figuring. the fine warp and weft weave together to form ground and make the firm binding, with the coarse warp and weft forming figure.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MITCHILINE, OR PATENT SATIN QUILTS: A quilt woven on a jacquard loom with the use of healds. It is a double cloth, composed of two plains cloths very firmly interwoven. The design is made by the two cloths interchanging. The bulk of these quilts are woven from all grey yarns, and bleached afterwards, but colour is sometimes used for the ground effects with the figure shew- ing in white. Many qualities are sold, and an average sample is 18's/36's for ground, with 36's/8's or 10's for figuring. The fine warp and weft weave together to form ground and make the firm binding, with the coarse warp and weft forming figure.
text: MITCHILINE, OR PATENT SATIN QUILTS: A quilt woven on a jacquard loom with the use of healds. It is a double cloth, composed of two plains cloths very firmly interwoven. The design is made by the two cloths interchanging. The bulk of these quilts are woven from all grey yarns, and bleached afterwards, but colour is sometimes used for the ground effects with the figure shew- ing in white. Many qualities are sold, and an average sample is 18's/36's for ground, with 36's/8's or 10's for figuring. The fine warp and weft weave together to form ground and make the firm binding, with the coarse warp and weft forming figure.

Definition: the first process carried out by the spinner, and is necessary to blend different varieties of raw cotton to obtain the required quality or colour or to neutralise irregularities of growth found more or less in all grades of cotton. the different bales of raw cotton are pulled into small pieces or into layers by the aid of pulling machines or "bale breakers.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MIXING COTTON: The first process carried out by the spinner, and is necessary to blend different varieties of raw cotton to obtain the required quality or colour or to neutralise irregularities of growth found more or less in all grades of cotton. The different bales of raw cotton are pulled into small pieces or into layers by the aid of pulling machines or "bale breakers.
text: MIXING COTTON: The first process carried out by the spinner, and is necessary to blend different varieties of raw cotton to obtain the required quality or colour or to neutralise irregularities of growth found more or less in all grades of cotton. The different bales of raw cotton are pulled into small pieces or into layers by the aid of pulling machines or "bale breakers.

Definition: a fancy yarn used in the wool trade. it is made from fibres which have been dyed in various colours, and these are mixed together to produce a desired tone.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MIXTURE YARN: A fancy yarn used in the wool trade. It is made from fibres which have been dyed in various colours, and these are mixed together to produce a desired tone.
text: MIXTURE YARN: A fancy yarn used in the wool trade. It is made from fibres which have been dyed in various colours, and these are mixed together to produce a desired tone.

Definition: an imitation gauze partly obtained by the method of reeding and partly by the weave. the simplest form is reeded three in a dent, with 1 and 3 ends working together plain, and number 2 or the centre end working 3 up 3 down. the centre thread pulls the 3 threads together, giv- ing the open effect aimed at. if an empty dent is left at each side the open effect is more pronounced.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOCK LENO: An imitation gauze partly obtained by the method of reeding and partly by the weave. The simplest form is reeded three in a dent, with 1 and 3 ends working together plain, and number 2 or the centre end working 3 up 3 down. The centre thread pulls the 3 threads together, giv- ing the open effect aimed at. If an empty dent is left at each side the open effect is more pronounced.
text: MOCK LENO: An imitation gauze partly obtained by the method of reeding and partly by the weave. The simplest form is reeded three in a dent, with 1 and 3 ends working together plain, and number 2 or the centre end working 3 up 3 down. The centre thread pulls the 3 threads together, giv- ing the open effect aimed at. If an empty dent is left at each side the open effect is more pronounced.

Definition: the wool obtained from the lustrous, white, fine, wavy, and long. to fabrics woven from mohair yarn.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOHAIR: The wool obtained from the lustrous, white, fine, wavy, and long. to fabrics woven from mohair yarn.
text: MOHAIR: The wool obtained from the lustrous, white, fine, wavy, and long. to fabrics woven from mohair yarn.

Definition: a lustre dress fabric made from a two-fold cotton warp, yarn dyed, and mohair weft, cross-dyed after weaving, usually 30 inch 35/40 yards, 2/60's cotton warp and 16's mohair weft. the cloth is very similar to "lustre orleans," but of a closer texture.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOHAIR BRILLIANTINE: A lustre dress fabric made from a two-fold cotton warp, yarn dyed, and mohair weft, cross-dyed after weaving, usually 30 inch 35/40 yards, 2/60's cotton warp and 16's mohair weft. The cloth is very similar to "Lustre Orleans," but of a closer texture.

Definition: an all-cotton fustian cloth with a great number of picks-raised before dyeing. used for workmen's clothing where very hard wear is required. this cloth, with the weft cut to form pile, is a corduroy.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOLESKINS: An all-cotton fustian cloth with a great number of picks-raised before dyeing. Used for workmen's clothing where very hard wear is required. This cloth, with the weft cut to form pile, is a corduroy.
text: MOLESKINS: An all-cotton fustian cloth with a great number of picks-raised before dyeing. Used for workmen's clothing where very hard wear is required. This cloth, with the weft cut to form pile, is a corduroy.

Definition: a loop pile fabric produced by the aid of wires as for brussels and other carpets, originally made by hand, in which case knotted tufts were used. also applied to a pile or velvet cloth used by up- holsterers, with pile one side only and either plain colours or figured.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOQUETTES: A loop pile fabric produced by the aid of wires as for Brussels and other carpets, originally made by hand, in which case knotted tufts were used. Also applied to a pile or velvet cloth used by up- holsterers, with pile one side only and either plain colours or figured.

Definition: any chemical substance used by dyers to fix colours to yarn or cloth.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MORDANTS: Any chemical substance used by dyers to fix colours to yarn or cloth.
text: MORDANTS: Any chemical substance used by dyers to fix colours to yarn or cloth.

Definition: a repp cloth woven from a thick cotton warp, and afterwards finished with a moir√© finish. the weft is much finer than the warp, and twice to three times as many picks as ends are used. standard makes are:- 30 in. 118 yards 46 x 108. 2/24's/40's t.w. 29 lb. 28 in. 90 yards 44 √ó 18's/40's t.w. 16 lb. 100.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOREEN: A repp cloth woven from a thick cotton warp, and afterwards finished with a moir√© finish. The weft is much finer than the warp, and twice to three times as many picks as ends are used. Standard makes are:- 30 in. 118 yards 46 x 108. 2/24's/40's T.W. 29 lb. 28 in. 90 yards 44 √ó 18's/40's T.W. 16 lb. 100.

Definition: a fine gauze cloth woven from very fine yarns. the yarns usually bleached. the picks are usually in " fives,' and known as the "5-bar net" ; yarns vary from 38's/40's to 50's/60's.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOSQUITO NET: A fine gauze cloth woven from very fine yarns. The yarns usually bleached. The picks are usually in " fives,' and known as the "5-bar net" ; yarns vary from 38's/40's to 50's/60's.
text: MOSQUITO NET: A fine gauze cloth woven from very fine yarns. The yarns usually bleached. The picks are usually in " fives,' and known as the "5-bar net" ; yarns vary from 38's/40's to 50's/60's.

Definition: fabrics woven from dyed yarns, the yarns being mottled. a cotton velvet cord with a pile surface shewing white and black mottled effect is also known under this name.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOTTLES: Fabrics woven from dyed yarns, the yarns being mottled. A cotton velvet cord with a pile surface shewing white and black mottled effect is also known under this name.
text: MOTTLES: Fabrics woven from dyed yarns, the yarns being mottled. A cotton velvet cord with a pile surface shewing white and black mottled effect is also known under this name.

Definition: a very light dress cloth with lappet ornaments. the lappet effects are in coloured yarn, usually 3/40's super egyptian, and the muslin ground 60's/80's, both combed and carded egyptian yarns.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOUTAN MUSLIN: A very light dress cloth with lappet ornaments. The lappet effects are in coloured yarn, usually 3/40's super Egyptian, and the muslin ground 60's/80's, both combed and carded Egyptian yarns.
text: MOUTAN MUSLIN: A very light dress cloth with lappet ornaments. The lappet effects are in coloured yarn, usually 3/40's super Egyptian, and the muslin ground 60's/80's, both combed and carded Egyptian yarns.

Definition: the french cloth is all wool, and generally printed in beautiful designs in many colours, and used for dress purposes. the weave is either plain or 2 x 1 twill. the english cloth is an imitation, and made from a cotton warp and worsted weft.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOUSSELINE DE LAINE: The French cloth is all wool, and generally printed in beautiful designs in many colours, and used for dress purposes. The weave is either plain or 2 x 1 twill. The English cloth is an imitation, and made from a cotton warp and worsted weft.

Definition: a chiffon fabric, all silk, very soft, and open in tex- ture.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MOUSSELINE DE SOIE: A chiffon fabric, all silk, very soft, and open in tex- ture.

Definition: this yarn is softer than ring spun yarn, and finer counts can be spun on the mule than on the ring frame. it is also more regular and makes a fuller cloth.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MULE YARN: This yarn is softer than ring spun yarn, and finer counts can be spun on the mule than on the ring frame. It is also more regular and makes a fuller cloth.
text: MULE YARN: This yarn is softer than ring spun yarn, and finer counts can be spun on the mule than on the ring frame. It is also more regular and makes a fuller cloth.

Definition: a plain cloth made from fine yarns, used for dress and other purposes. the cloth is bleached and soft finished. yarns 60's to 90's or 100's both warp and weft. china or silk mull is a union cloth of silk and cotton, and very fine in texture. india and swiss mulls are other names for the plain bleached mull.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MULL: A plain cloth made from fine yarns, used for dress and other purposes. The cloth is bleached and soft finished. Yarns 60's to 90's or 100's both warp and weft. China or Silk Mull is a union cloth of silk and cotton, and very fine in texture. India and Swiss Mulls are other names for the plain bleached mull.

Definition: recovered wool fibres obtained from hard wool rags, cuttings, and other wool waste. it is a low grade of shoddy.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MUNGO: Recovered wool fibres obtained from hard wool rags, cuttings, and other wool waste. It is a low grade of shoddy.
text: MUNGO: Recovered wool fibres obtained from hard wool rags, cuttings, and other wool waste. It is a low grade of shoddy.

Definition: a very light, open, plain cloth used for summer dress purposes made in many qualities. made from super yarns. hair muslin has fine cord stripes. crammed muslin, same as hair muslin. muslins, lawns, mulls, and cambrics are all very similar in weave and yarns, but a muslin is perhaps the lowest in quality. all muslins are very soft to the touch. book muslin and tarleton muslin are not true muslins, since they are not soft but hard to the touch.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: MUSLIN: A very light, open, plain cloth used for summer dress purposes made in many qualities. Made from super yarns. Hair muslin has fine cord stripes. Crammed muslin, same as Hair muslin. Muslins, lawns, mulls, and cambrics are all very similar in weave and yarns, but a muslin is perhaps the lowest in quality. All muslins are very soft to the touch. Book muslin and Tarleton muslin are not true muslins, since they are not soft but hard to the touch.

Definition: a light cotton cloth, plain weave, in widths 30 to 32 in. bleached and soft finished. a common quality is 108 √ó 96 40's/46's. ‚ä¢ the cloth can be termed a fine white shirting.
Title: Glossary of textile terms

Definition: the real nankeen is a hand loom production from nanking, china, made from a cotton locally grown which has a natural yellow tint. woven 18 to 20 in. and plain weave. the lancashire nankeen is a 3-end twill cloth made from ordinary cotton and dyed a yellowish drab. used for pocketings and corsets.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NANKEEN: The real nankeen is a hand loom production from Nanking, China, made from a cotton locally grown which has a natural yellow tint. Woven 18 to 20 in. and plain weave. The Lancashire nankeen is a 3-end twill cloth made from ordinary cotton and dyed a yellowish drab. Used for pocketings and corsets.

The Lancashire nankeen is a 3-end twill cloth made from ordinary cotton and dyed a yellowish drab. Used for pocketings and corsets.

Combined: NANKEEN TWILL: The three-end twill 2 √ó 1 lift.
text: NANKEEN TWILL: The three-end twill 2 √ó 1 lift.

Definition: the woolly face given to the surface of a cloth such as seen on nap overcoats or on flannels and flanelettes.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NAP: The woolly face given to the surface of a cloth such as seen on nap overcoats or on flannels and flanelettes.
text: NAP: The woolly face given to the surface of a cloth such as seen on nap overcoats or on flannels and flanelettes.

Definition: african cloths, all cotton, made to imitate the native made cloths, which are woven on "hand looms" in widths from 4 to 6 in. from six to ten of these narrow fabrics are sewn together, and the stitching shews up as a thick cord. the lancashire maker imitates this as near as possible. widths 30 to 40 in., 100 yards long, 52 ends, 40 picks, 8's grey, 10's colour warps, 7's waste weft. cords every 4 in. made by three ends of the 8's warp working as one. they are shipped in the loom state in 6, 8, or 10 yard ends.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NATIVE STRIPES: African cloths, all cotton, made to imitate the native made cloths, which are woven on "hand looms" in widths from 4 to 6 in. From six to ten of these narrow fabrics are sewn together, and the stitching shews up as a thick cord. The Lancashire maker imitates this as near as possible. Widths 30 to 40 in., 100 yards long, 52 ends, 40 picks, 8's grey, 10's colour warps, 7's waste weft. Cords every 4 in. made by three ends of the 8's warp working as one. They are shipped in the loom state in 6, 8, or 10 yard ends.
text: NATIVE STRIPES: African cloths, all cotton, made to imitate the native made cloths, which are woven on "hand looms" in widths from 4 to 6 in. From six to ten of these narrow fabrics are sewn together, and the stitching shews up as a thick cord. The Lancashire maker imitates this as near as possible. Widths 30 to 40 in., 100 yards long, 52 ends, 40 picks, 8's grey, 10's colour warps, 7's waste weft. Cords every 4 in. made by three ends of the 8's warp working as one. They are shipped in the loom state in 6, 8, or 10 yard ends.

Definition: a shedding motion that only raises or sinks the warp threads, the reverse movement being controlled by springs or pulleys.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NEGATIVE SHEDDING: A shedding motion that only raises or sinks the warp threads, the reverse movement being controlled by springs or pulleys.
text: NEGATIVE SHEDDING: A shedding motion that only raises or sinks the warp threads, the reverse movement being controlled by springs or pulleys.

Definition: a take-up motion generally used on looms for weaving such heavy fabrics as velvets, fustians, and other cloths where a large number of picks are woven. weavers, as a rule, for weaving these fabrics are paid by the weight of weft woven, and not by the length of cloth and the number of picks per in.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NEGATIVE TAKE-UP OR DRAG MOTION: A take-up motion generally used on looms for weaving such heavy fabrics as velvets, fustians, and other cloths where a large number of picks are woven. Weavers, as a rule, for weaving these fabrics are paid by the weight of weft woven, and not by the length of cloth and the number of picks per in.
text: NEGATIVE TAKE-UP OR DRAG MOTION: A take-up motion generally used on looms for weaving such heavy fabrics as velvets, fustians, and other cloths where a large number of picks are woven. Weavers, as a rule, for weaving these fabrics are paid by the weight of weft woven, and not by the length of cloth and the number of picks per in.

Definition: openwork ondul√© designs made from the finest egyptian cotton, or silk and wool, in which the doup cord used floats on the surface of the cloth, and is so interlaced as to form wavy effects. the cords are much thicker than the ground.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NET, OR SPIDER LENO: Openwork ondul√© designs made from the finest Egyptian cotton, or silk and wool, in which the doup cord used floats on the surface of the cloth, and is so interlaced as to form wavy effects. The cords are much thicker than the ground.
text: NET, OR SPIDER LENO: Openwork ondul√© designs made from the finest Egyptian cotton, or silk and wool, in which the doup cord used floats on the surface of the cloth, and is so interlaced as to form wavy effects. The cords are much thicker than the ground.

Definition: a red and white matting cloth for the south american trade. stiff finished, and shipped in 12-yard ends. made in 30 and 42 in. widths, 104 ends, 36 picks, 30's/40's, sized warp, two ends working together. warp stripes in red and white, white weft.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NICANIES: A red and white matting cloth for the South American trade. Stiff finished, and shipped in 12-yard ends. Made in 30 and 42 in. widths, 104 ends, 36 picks, 30's/40's, sized warp, two ends working together. Warp stripes in red and white, white weft.
text: NICANIES: A red and white matting cloth for the South American trade. Stiff finished, and shipped in 12-yard ends. Made in 30 and 42 in. widths, 104 ends, 36 picks, 30's/40's, sized warp, two ends working together. Warp stripes in red and white, white weft.

Definition: a fancy dress goods cloth made from a spiral yarn warp and a mixture weft (cotton and wool). the two threads forming the doubled warp yarn are both hard twisted. the design is a small spot on 12 shafts; piece dyed black or blue.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NIGGERHEAD CURL: A fancy dress goods cloth made from a spiral yarn warp and a mixture weft (cotton and wool). The two threads forming the doubled warp yarn are both hard twisted. The design is a small spot on 12 shafts; piece dyed black or blue.
text: NIGGERHEAD CURL: A fancy dress goods cloth made from a spiral yarn warp and a mixture weft (cotton and wool). The two threads forming the doubled warp yarn are both hard twisted. The design is a small spot on 12 shafts; piece dyed black or blue.

Definition: a yorkshire make of dress material with dobby effects. fancy yarns are used, with small bunches of yarn twisted in.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NODE: A Yorkshire make of dress material with dobby effects. Fancy yarns are used, with small bunches of yarn twisted in.
text: NODE: A Yorkshire make of dress material with dobby effects. Fancy yarns are used, with small bunches of yarn twisted in.

Definition: the short rejected fibres obtained when combing worsted. these are spun again into a thread, and generally dyed.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NOILS: The short rejected fibres obtained when combing worsted. These are spun again into a thread, and generally dyed.
text: NOILS: The short rejected fibres obtained when combing worsted. These are spun again into a thread, and generally dyed.

Definition: cloths made from noil yarns (silk or worsted). two beams generally used, one for the ground ends dented 4 in a dent, the other for the thicker noil yarn dented 2 in a dent. the noil yarn is dyed in bright colours to form stripes. the weft is usually black dyed cotton, and the ground warp also black dyed cotton. many of these cloths are shipped to the west coast of africa.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NOIL STRIPES: Cloths made from noil yarns (silk or worsted). Two beams generally used, one for the ground ends dented 4 in a dent, the other for the thicker noil yarn dented 2 in a dent. The noil yarn is dyed in bright colours to form stripes. The weft is usually black dyed cotton, and the ground warp also black dyed cotton. Many of these cloths are shipped to the West Coast of Africa.
text: NOIL STRIPES: Cloths made from noil yarns (silk or worsted). Two beams generally used, one for the ground ends dented 4 in a dent, the other for the thicker noil yarn dented 2 in a dent. The noil yarn is dyed in bright colours to form stripes. The weft is usually black dyed cotton, and the ground warp also black dyed cotton. Many of these cloths are shipped to the West Coast of Africa.

Definition: when this term is used it means that the particulars given are not as stated; for instance, 36 in. nominal may be 35 to 35 in., 32's/40's nominal may be 36's/44's.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NOMINAL: When this term is used it means that the particulars given are not as stated; for instance, 36 in. nominal may be 35 to 35 in., 32's/40's nominal may be 36's/44's.
text: NOMINAL: When this term is used it means that the particulars given are not as stated; for instance, 36 in. nominal may be 35 to 35 in., 32's/40's nominal may be 36's/44's.

Definition: a cloth very similar to georgettes, and made from fine silk warp and cotton weft, the crepe being produced by the weave.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NORWICH CREPE: A cloth very similar to Georgettes, and made from fine silk warp and cotton weft, the crepe being produced by the weave.
text: NORWICH CREPE: A cloth very similar to Georgettes, and made from fine silk warp and cotton weft, the crepe being produced by the weave.

Definition: an indian cotton used locally. the crop is a small one, and the cotton is picked by hand. nuns originally picked the cotton, and the yarn made from it was used to manufacture clothing for the priests.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NUN'S COTTON: An Indian cotton used locally. The crop is a small one, and the cotton is picked by hand. Nuns originally picked the cotton, and the yarn made from it was used to manufacture clothing for the priests.
text: NUN'S COTTON: An Indian cotton used locally. The crop is a small one, and the cotton is picked by hand. Nuns originally picked the cotton, and the yarn made from it was used to manufacture clothing for the priests.

Definition: a fine plain weave fabric used for blouses-dyed many shades. all-wool yarns of very good quality, 60 in. wide, 44 √ó 46 ends and picks, 48's/60's worsted, and many better qualities.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: NUN'S VEILING: A fine plain weave fabric used for blouses-dyed many shades. All-wool yarns of very good quality, 60 in. wide, 44 √ó 46 ends and picks, 48's/60's worsted, and many better qualities.
text: NUN'S VEILING: A fine plain weave fabric used for blouses-dyed many shades. All-wool yarns of very good quality, 60 in. wide, 44 √ó 46 ends and picks, 48's/60's worsted, and many better qualities.

Definition: fabrics woven from a fine warp and coarse weft, with a rough surface produced by an irregular cr√©pe weave from 5 shafts upwards. the oatmeal weave is much used as a ground weave for dobby and jacquard effects.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: OATMEAL CLOTHS: Fabrics woven from a fine warp and coarse weft, with a rough surface produced by an irregular cr√©pe weave from 5 shafts upwards. The oatmeal weave is much used as a ground weave for dobby and jacquard effects.
text: OATMEAL CLOTHS: Fabrics woven from a fine warp and coarse weft, with a rough surface produced by an irregular cr√©pe weave from 5 shafts upwards. The oatmeal weave is much used as a ground weave for dobby and jacquard effects.

Definition: a term applied to design, and means stripes shading from light to dark. produced by different tones of the same colour in the warp yarns.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: OMBRE: A term applied to design, and means stripes shading from light to dark. Produced by different tones of the same colour in the warp yarns.
text: OMBRE: A term applied to design, and means stripes shading from light to dark. Produced by different tones of the same colour in the warp yarns.

Definition: a wavy effect in the warp produced by special reeds, and often combined with leno weaves, which throw up the waves.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: ONDULE: A wavy effect in the warp produced by special reeds, and often combined with leno weaves, which throw up the waves.
text: ONDULE: A wavy effect in the warp produced by special reeds, and often combined with leno weaves, which throw up the waves.

Definition: owing to the pressure put on the cotton when made into bales the fibre is matted when the bales are opened. to open out the cotton it is beaten about in an enclosed drum bounded by grids. the impurities (leaf, sand, etc.) fall through the grids, while the light cotton fibres pass forward.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: OPENING COTTON: Owing to the pressure put on the cotton when made into bales the fibre is matted when the bales are opened. To open out the cotton it is beaten about in an enclosed drum bounded by grids. The impurities (leaf, sand, etc.) fall through the grids, while the light cotton fibres pass forward.
text: OPENING COTTON: Owing to the pressure put on the cotton when made into bales the fibre is matted when the bales are opened. To open out the cotton it is beaten about in an enclosed drum bounded by grids. The impurities (leaf, sand, etc.) fall through the grids, while the light cotton fibres pass forward.

Definition: a thin, light, and transparent fabric in stripes or checks, no colour, but stripes of plain and satin, etc. very fine yarns, such as 80's/100's. usually the satin effects are crammed in the reed. have a stiff, glossy finish.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: ORGANDIE: A thin, light, and transparent fabric in stripes or checks, no colour, but stripes of plain and satin, etc. Very fine yarns, such as 80's/100's. Usually The satin effects are crammed in the reed. have a stiff, glossy finish.
text: ORGANDIE: A thin, light, and transparent fabric in stripes or checks, no colour, but stripes of plain and satin, etc. Very fine yarns, such as 80's/100's. Usually The satin effects are crammed in the reed. have a stiff, glossy finish.

Definition: from silk yarns with a large number of turns per inch and two or more twisted together. mainly used for warps. care is taken not to give too much twist, since the twisting reduces the lustre. an italian term meaning extra spun.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: ORGANZINE SILK: From silk yarns with a large number of turns per inch and two or more twisted together. Mainly used for warps. Care is taken not to give too much twist, since the twisting reduces the lustre. An Italian term meaning extra spun.
text: ORGANZINE SILK: From silk yarns with a large number of turns per inch and two or more twisted together. Mainly used for warps. Care is taken not to give too much twist, since the twisting reduces the lustre. An Italian term meaning extra spun.

Definition: also known as lustre orleans, and is a plain weave cloth woven from a fine cotton warp and worsted weft. used for dress purposes. made in a fine reed, and very closely woven.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: ORLEANS CLOTH: Also known as Lustre Orleans, and is a plain weave cloth woven from a fine cotton warp and worsted weft. Used for dress purposes. Made in a fine reed, and very closely woven.
text: ORLEANS CLOTH: Also known as Lustre Orleans, and is a plain weave cloth woven from a fine cotton warp and worsted weft. Used for dress purposes. Made in a fine reed, and very closely woven.

Definition: the best and most regular of the american cottons. of good staple and colour, and can be spun into yarn as fine as 60's.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: ORLEANS COTTON: The best and most regular of the American cottons. Of good staple and colour, and can be spun into yarn as fine as 60's.
text: ORLEANS COTTON: The best and most regular of the American cottons. Of good staple and colour, and can be spun into yarn as fine as 60's.

Definition: a fabric made in bradford, and used as a lining for dress goods. yarns are fine cotton warp, worsted weft, either plain weave or figured, and generally dyed.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: ORLEANS LININGS: A fabric made in Bradford, and used as a lining for dress goods. Yarns are fine cotton warp, worsted weft, either plain weave or figured, and generally dyed.
text: ORLEANS LININGS: A fabric made in Bradford, and used as a lining for dress goods. Yarns are fine cotton warp, worsted weft, either plain weave or figured, and generally dyed.

Definition: a terry or turkish towel woven with a special motion where the reed is so worked as to allow 6 picks to be in- serted for each horizontal row of loops, thus producing a stronger and firmer towel than the ordinary turkish towel. it is a trade name.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: OSMAN TURKISH TOWELS: A terry or Turkish towel woven with a special motion where the reed is so worked as to allow 6 picks to be in- serted for each horizontal row of loops, thus producing a stronger and firmer towel than the ordinary Turkish towel. It is a trade name.
text: OSMAN TURKISH TOWELS: A terry or Turkish towel woven with a special motion where the reed is so worked as to allow 6 picks to be in- serted for each horizontal row of loops, thus producing a stronger and firmer towel than the ordinary Turkish towel. It is a trade name.

Definition: this name was derived from the province of osnaburg, where the cloth was originally made from coarse flax yarns in a plain weave. it is now made from all cotton of very coarse counts, such as 14's to 24's warp, and 6's to 8's weft, or coarser. 28 to 40 ends, 32 to 36 picks. shipped to west africa, the canary islands, and other ports. when stripes or checks are introduced the cloth sells well in the southern states of america.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: OSNABURG: This name was derived from the province of Osnaburg, where the cloth was originally made from coarse flax yarns in a plain weave. It is now made from all cotton of very coarse counts, such as 14's to 24's warp, and 6's to 8's weft, or coarser. 28 to 40 ends, 32 to 36 picks. Shipped to West Africa, the Canary Islands, and other ports. When stripes or checks are introduced the cloth sells well in the Southern States of America.
text: OSNABURG: This name was derived from the province of Osnaburg, where the cloth was originally made from coarse flax yarns in a plain weave. It is now made from all cotton of very coarse counts, such as 14's to 24's warp, and 6's to 8's weft, or coarser. 28 to 40 ends, 32 to 36 picks. Shipped to West Africa, the Canary Islands, and other ports. When stripes or checks are introduced the cloth sells well in the Southern States of America.

Definition: a dress fabric of warp rib weave from hard spun yarns. originally silk was used, but now cotton is employed. the ribs are formed at intervals to give stripe effects. the rib is known as the ottoman cord, and is broad and flat. it is much used as a ground weave for figured poplins in which silk and wool or silk and cotton are the yarns.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: OTTOMAN: A dress fabric of warp rib weave from hard spun yarns. Originally silk was used, but now cotton is employed. The ribs are formed at intervals to give stripe effects. The rib is known as the ottoman cord, and is broad and flat. It is much used as a ground weave for figured poplins in which silk and wool or silk and cotton are the yarns.
text: OTTOMAN: A dress fabric of warp rib weave from hard spun yarns. Originally silk was used, but now cotton is employed. The ribs are formed at intervals to give stripe effects. The rib is known as the ottoman cord, and is broad and flat. It is much used as a ground weave for figured poplins in which silk and wool or silk and cotton are the yarns.

Definition: indicates a check design introduced over a ground check. generally the overcheck is of a different colour.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: OVERCHECKS: Indicates a check design introduced over a ground check. Generally the overcheck is of a different colour.
text: OVERCHECKS: Indicates a check design introduced over a ground check. Generally the overcheck is of a different colour.

Definition: the method of picking in which the picking stick is caused to move through the arc of a circle over the top of the shuttle box.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: OVERPICK: The method of picking in which the picking stick is caused to move through the arc of a circle over the top of the shuttle box.
text: OVERPICK: The method of picking in which the picking stick is caused to move through the arc of a circle over the top of the shuttle box.

Definition: all cotton shirting cloths, plain weave, with two ends working as one. fancy effects are introduced in colour yarns forming stripes, or the dobby machine is used. yarns are of good quality, and vary from 24's to 30's warp and 12's to 16's weft, and from 70 to 100 ends and 44 to 50 picks.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: OXFORDS: All cotton shirting cloths, plain weave, with two ends working as one. Fancy effects are introduced in colour yarns forming stripes, or the dobby machine is used. Yarns are of good quality, and vary from 24's to 30's warp and 12's to 16's weft, and from 70 to 100 ends and 44 to 50 picks.
text: OXFORDS: All cotton shirting cloths, plain weave, with two ends working as one. Fancy effects are introduced in colour yarns forming stripes, or the dobby machine is used. Yarns are of good quality, and vary from 24's to 30's warp and 12's to 16's weft, and from 70 to 100 ends and 44 to 50 picks.

Definition: twill weave all-cotton cloths of many qualities and widths. printed both sides-on the face with the fancy pattern, and on the back they are printed black to pre- vent the face pattern shewing through. cheap quality, 40 in. 64 yds. 72 √ó 72 36's/38's. medium quality, 40 in. 64 yds. 72 √ó 96 34's/34's. g1
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PADDED-BACK LININGS: Twill weave all-cotton cloths of many qualities and widths. Printed both sides-on the face with the fancy pattern, and on the back they are printed black to pre- vent the face pattern shewing through. Cheap quality, 40 in. 64 yds. 72 √ó 72 36's/38's. Medium quality, 40 in. 64 yds. 72 √ó 96 34's/34's. G1
text: PADDED-BACK LININGS: Twill weave all-cotton cloths of many qualities and widths. Printed both sides-on the face with the fancy pattern, and on the back they are printed black to pre- vent the face pattern shewing through. Cheap quality, 40 in. 64 yds. 72 √ó 72 36's/38's.
