Definition: the system of dyeing in which the cloth passes through a series of dye vats instead of lying in the dye, as is the case with ordinary dyeing. the object of the two systems is the same, but pad-dyeing is quicker.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PAD-DYEING: The system of dyeing in which the cloth passes through a series of dye vats instead of lying in the dye, as is the case with ordinary dyeing. The object of the two systems is the same, but pad-dyeing is quicker.
text: PAD-DYEING: The system of dyeing in which the cloth passes through a series of dye vats instead of lying in the dye, as is the case with ordinary dyeing. The object of the two systems is the same, but pad-dyeing is quicker.

Definition: same as sarongs, but woven in different lengths and headings.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PALENBANGS: Same as Sarongs, but woven in different lengths and headings.
text: PALENBANGS: Same as Sarongs, but woven in different lengths and headings.

Definition: an all-cotton cloth woven from dyed yarns in a plain matt weave, double ends and double picks. 36 in. 80 yards 60 x 60 20's/16's, and many other qualities.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PANAMA CANVAS: An all-cotton cloth woven from dyed yarns in a plain matt weave, double ends and double picks. 36 in. 80 yards 60 x 60 20's/16's, and many other qualities.
text: PANAMA CANVAS: An all-cotton cloth woven from dyed yarns in a plain matt weave, double ends and double picks. 36 in. 80 yards 60 x 60 20's/16's, and many other qualities.

Definition: dobby cloths on 12 to 16 shafts, in coloured stripe and small figured effects. they are bleached, and some also dyed in light colours, such as cream, yellow, light blue. shipped to south america, egypt, persia, etc. 26 in. 100 yds. 72 x 72 36's/32's, 30's colour.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PANAMA ZEPHYRS: Dobby cloths on 12 to 16 shafts, in coloured stripe and small figured effects. They are bleached, and some also dyed in light colours, such as cream, yellow, light blue. Shipped to South America, Egypt, Persia, etc. 26 in. 100 yds. 72 x 72 36's/32's, 30's colour.
text: PANAMA ZEPHYRS: Dobby cloths on 12 to 16 shafts, in coloured stripe and small figured effects. They are bleached, and some also dyed in light colours, such as cream, yellow, light blue. Shipped to South America, Egypt, Persia, etc. 26 in. 100 yds. 72 x 72 36's/32's, 30's colour.

Definition: derived from the french word "panne‚äîplush‚äîand is a light velvet with a flattened pile. the ground warp is a good quality two-fold cotton yarn, pile warp of spun silk, and the weft a twofold cotton. the weave is arranged three picks to one wire, and two ground ends to one pile- the pile is raised over each wire and very firmly bound by the three picks.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PANNE: Derived from the French word "panne‚Äîplush‚Äîand is a light velvet with a flattened pile. The ground warp is a good quality two-fold cotton yarn, pile warp of spun silk, and the weft a twofold cotton. The weave is arranged three picks to one wire, and two ground ends to one pile- the pile is raised over each wire and very firmly bound by the three picks.
text: PANNE: Derived from the French word "panne‚Äîplush‚Äîand is a light velvet with a flattened pile. The ground warp is a good quality two-fold cotton yarn, pile warp of spun silk, and the weft a twofold cotton. The weave is arranged three picks to one wire, and two ground ends to one pile- the pile is raised over each wire and very firmly bound by the three picks.

Definition: this cloth is a papoon woven in designs of stripe and check effects to meet requirements of the siamese for dress purposes.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PANNING: This cloth is a papoon woven in designs of stripe and check effects to meet requirements of the Siamese for dress purposes.
text: PANNING: This cloth is a papoon woven in designs of stripe and check effects to meet requirements of the Siamese for dress purposes.

Definition: a plain cloth with warp and weft yarns of different colours, such as red and blue. also made in checks.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PAPOON: A plain cloth with warp and weft yarns of different colours, such as red and blue. Also made in checks.
text: PAPOON: A plain cloth with warp and weft yarns of different colours, such as red and blue. Also made in checks.

Definition: originally applied to a dress goods fabric made from paramatta wool and silk. it is now made with a cotton warp and botany weft-2 x 1 weft twill. the cloth is used for proofing. (also see coburg.)
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PARAMATTAS: Originally applied to a dress goods fabric made from paramatta wool and silk. It is now made with a cotton warp and botany weft-2 x 1 weft twill. The cloth is used for proofing. (Also see Coburg.)
text: PARAMATTAS: Originally applied to a dress goods fabric made from paramatta wool and silk. It is now made with a cotton warp and botany weft-2 x 1 weft twill. The cloth is used for proofing. (Also see Coburg.)

Definition: another name for sarongs given to the cloth when shipped to the philippines. made in stripes and checks, and when finished cut into 6-yard ends.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PATADEONES: Another name for Sarongs given to the cloth when shipped to the Philippines. Made in stripes and checks, and when finished cut into 6-yard ends.
text: PATADEONES: Another name for Sarongs given to the cloth when shipped to the Philippines. Made in stripes and checks, and when finished cut into 6-yard ends.

Definition: a superor class of carpet made on the chenille prin- ciple. they are made to any width and length, with borders and cross borders, and woven in one piece. four or five warps are used of hemp, cotton, and other fibres. the chenille weft is so made that all the fibres project in one direction; about 7 picks per inch are inserted, with two ground picks of ordinary yarn between each two. the chenille is put in by hand, and then combed forward to get all the pile straight. this chenille has its tufts made from wool or silk noil on a super quality cotton base. the woven carpets are sheared to level the pile.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PATENT AXMINSTER CARPETS: A superor class of carpet made on the chenille prin- ciple. They are made to any width and length, with borders and cross borders, and woven in one piece. Four or five warps are used of hemp, cotton, and other fibres. The chenille weft is so made that all the fibres project in one direction; about 7 picks per inch are inserted, with two ground picks of ordinary yarn between each two. The chenille is put in by hand, and then combed forward to get all the pile straight. This chenille has its tufts made from wool or silk noil on a super quality cotton base. The woven carpets are sheared to level the pile.
text: PATENT AXMINSTER CARPETS: A superor class of carpet made on the chenille prin- ciple. They are made to any width and length, with borders and cross borders, and woven in one piece. Four or five warps are used of hemp, cotton, and other fibres. The chenille weft is so made that all the fibres project in one direction; about 7 picks per inch are inserted, with two ground picks of ordinary yarn between each two. The chenille is put in by hand, and then combed forward to get all the pile straight. This chenille has its tufts made from wool or silk noil on a super quality cotton base. The woven carpets are sheared to level the pile.

Definition: are not satins at all, but a quilting fabric. it is also known as the mitcheline fabric." made from two plain cloths on jacquard looms‚äîone cloth has a fine warp and coarse weft, the other a coarse warp and fine weft. the two cloths so weave together that a raised figure of the coarse weft is formed upon a fine plain ground. the set is 2 face 1 back. the coarse weft varies from 4's to a coarse bump yarn.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PATENT SATINS: Are not satins at all, but a quilting fabric. It is also known as the Mitcheline Fabric." Made from two plain cloths on jacquard looms‚Äîone cloth has a fine warp and coarse weft, the other a coarse warp and fine weft. The two cloths so weave together that a raised figure of the coarse weft is formed upon a fine plain ground. The set is 2 face 1 back. The coarse weft varies from 4's to a coarse bump yarn.
text: PATENT SATINS: Are not satins at all, but a quilting fabric. It is also known as the Mitcheline Fabric." Made from two plain cloths on jacquard looms‚Äîone cloth has a fine warp and coarse weft, the other a coarse warp and fine weft. The two cloths so weave together that a raised figure of the coarse weft is formed upon a fine plain ground. The set is 2 face 1 back. The coarse weft varies from 4's to a coarse bump yarn.

Definition: a weft pile velvet cloth made in a cord weave. cut and finished a round cord effect is prominent.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PATENT VELVETS: A weft pile velvet cloth made in a cord weave. cut and finished a round cord effect is prominent.
text: PATENT VELVETS: A weft pile velvet cloth made in a cord weave. cut and finished a round cord effect is prominent.

Definition: an artificial silk manufactured by dissolving cellulose in schweitzer's solution. it is not so lustrous as some of the better known art silks, and when wet is rather brittle.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PAULY SILK: An artificial silk manufactured by dissolving cellulose in Schweitzer's solution. It is not so lustrous as some of the better known art silks, and when wet is rather brittle.
text: PAULY SILK: An artificial silk manufactured by dissolving cellulose in Schweitzer's solution. It is not so lustrous as some of the better known art silks, and when wet is rather brittle.

Definition: a very fine silk fabric in a crepe effect, close weave and fine counts. manufactured and finished in a glossy style by french makers.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PEAU DE CYGNE (Skin of the Swan)- : A very fine silk fabric in a crepe effect, close weave and fine counts. Manufactured and finished in a glossy style by French makers.
text: PEAU DE CYGNE (Skin of the Swan)- : A very fine silk fabric in a crepe effect, close weave and fine counts. Manufactured and finished in a glossy style by French makers.

Definition: a fancy silk cloth made on a satin base on 8 shafts from natural silks. the weave effect has a rib appear- ance from selvedge to selvedge, and the cloth is reversible. of french make and finish.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PEAU DE SOIE (Skin of Silk)‚Äî : A fancy silk cloth made on a satin base on 8 shafts from natural silks. The weave effect has a rib appear- ance from selvedge to selvedge, and the cloth is reversible. Of French make and finish.
text: PEAU DE SOIE (Skin of Silk)‚Äî : A fancy silk cloth made on a satin base on 8 shafts from natural silks. The weave effect has a rib appear- ance from selvedge to selvedge, and the cloth is reversible. Of French make and finish.

Definition: this is really the weaving plan, and is a plan shewing the order for putting pegs in the dobby lags, or gives the setting for the tappets. other terms for the same thing are:- weaving plan," "tappet plan," "tappet plan," "lifting plan,' or tie-up."
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PEGGING PLAN: This is really the weaving plan, and is a plan shewing the order for putting pegs in the dobby lags, or gives the setting for the tappets. Other terms for the same thing are:- weaving plan," "tappet plan," "tappet plan," "lifting plan,' or tie-up."
text: PEGGING PLAN: This is really the weaving plan, and is a plan shewing the order for putting pegs in the dobby lags, or gives the setting for the tappets. Other terms for the same thing are:- weaving plan," "tappet plan," "tappet plan," "lifting plan,' or tie-up."

Definition: this term really indicates a design in which stripes of equal width in white and colours are designed. a silk cloth known as "pekin" is a dress fabric with broad stripes of satin alternating with the same width of stripes of a white repp.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PEKIN: This term really indicates a design in which stripes of equal width in white and colours are designed. A silk cloth known as "pekin" is a dress fabric with broad stripes of satin alternating with the same width of stripes of a white repp.
text: PEKIN: This term really indicates a design in which stripes of equal width in white and colours are designed. A silk cloth known as "pekin" is a dress fabric with broad stripes of satin alternating with the same width of stripes of a white repp.

Definition: a pekin fabric with the stripes separated by a heavy raised cord. the cord is a two or three fold yarn, each thread of the compound cord being of a different colour.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PEKIN NOUVEAUTE: A pekin fabric with the stripes separated by a heavy raised cord. The cord is a two or three fold yarn, each thread of the compound cord being of a different colour.
text: PEKIN NOUVEAUTE: A pekin fabric with the stripes separated by a heavy raised cord. The cord is a two or three fold yarn, each thread of the compound cord being of a different colour.

Definition: the term given to stripe fabrics in which the different coloured stripes are all the same width; generally silk cloths are meant, but cotton pekin stripes have been shipped. the goods are for the china markets.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PEKIN STRIPES: The term given to stripe fabrics in which the different coloured stripes are all the same width; generally silk cloths are meant, but cotton pekin stripes have been shipped. The goods are for the China markets.
text: PEKIN STRIPES: The term given to stripe fabrics in which the different coloured stripes are all the same width; generally silk cloths are meant, but cotton pekin stripes have been shipped. The goods are for the China markets.

Definition: a french cloth made from silk warp and cotton weft, fine yarns, close weave, in the pekin stripe style, with narrow stripes of velvet introduced.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PEKIN VELOURS: A French cloth made from silk warp and cotton weft, fine yarns, close weave, in the pekin stripe style, with narrow stripes of velvet introduced.
text: PEKIN VELOURS: A French cloth made from silk warp and cotton weft, fine yarns, close weave, in the pekin stripe style, with narrow stripes of velvet introduced.

Definition: the best of drills made from super yarns and very well woven are known as peperell drills. an american drill known by this term is an ordinary drill or jean, made originally by the american company of that name and shipped to india and other markets.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PEPERELL JEANS, OR DRILLS: The best of drills made from super yarns and very well woven are known as peperell drills. An American drill known by this term is an ordinary drill or jean, made originally by the American company of that name and shipped to India and other markets.
text: PEPERELL JEANS, OR DRILLS: The best of drills made from super yarns and very well woven are known as peperell drills. An American drill known by this term is an ordinary drill or jean, made originally by the American company of that name and shipped to India and other markets.

Definition: a super yarn cambric, generally bleached, printed, and finished without gloss. the best qualities are made in france. usually 34 to 36 inches wide. 120 x 120, 60's/50's to 40's/50's.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PERCALE: A super yarn cambric, generally bleached, printed, and finished without gloss. The best qualities are made in France. Usually 34 to 36 inches wide. 120 x 120, 60's/50's to 40's/50's.
text: PERCALE: A super yarn cambric, generally bleached, printed, and finished without gloss. The best qualities are made in France. Usually 34 to 36 inches wide. 120 x 120, 60's/50's to 40's/50's.

Definition: a south american term for shirting stripes such as 30/1 in. 40 yards finished, 74 x 74, 36's/34's, with 10 ends, 30's colour, and 4 cords 2/16's per inch. designs are all small patterns in opal, indigo, black, helio, brown, and green. the grey width is 32 in., and the cloth is bleached and slightly assisted in the finish.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PERCALE STRIPES: A South American term for shirting stripes such as 30/1 in. 40 yards finished, 74 x 74, 36's/34's, with 10 ends, 30's colour, and 4 cords 2/16's per inch. Designs are all small patterns in opal, indigo, black, helio, brown, and green. The grey width is 32 in., and the cloth is bleached and slightly assisted in the finish.
text: PERCALE STRIPES: A South American term for shirting stripes such as 30/1 in. 40 yards finished, 74 x 74, 36's/34's, with 10 ends, 30's colour, and 4 cords 2/16's per inch. Designs are all small patterns in opal, indigo, black, helio, brown, and green. The grey width is 32 in., and the cloth is bleached and slightly assisted in the finish.

Definition: a plain cambric cloth used for shirts and dress pur- poses. a finer cloth than percale, but has a stiff, glossy finish. generally bleached, but also piece dyed.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PERCALINE: A plain cambric cloth used for shirts and dress pur- poses. A finer cloth than percale, but has a stiff, glossy finish. Generally bleached, but also piece dyed.
text: PERCALINE: A plain cambric cloth used for shirts and dress pur- poses. A finer cloth than percale, but has a stiff, glossy finish. Generally bleached, but also piece dyed.

Definition: hand made by persian and indian natives. the looms are of very simple construction. there are rollers at the top and bottom of the frame, and on these are stretched the threads for the warp or ground. tufts of coloured woollen yarn are knotted on the warp threads, and over each row of tufts a wool weft is passed and beaten well up for binding. the carpets are very costly, and of very elabo- rate designs and very durable.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PERSIAN CARPETS: Hand made by Persian and Indian natives. The looms are of very simple construction. There are rollers at the top and bottom of the frame, and on these are stretched the threads for the warp or ground. Tufts of coloured woollen yarn are knotted on the warp threads, and over each row of tufts a wool weft is passed and beaten well up for binding. The carpets are very costly, and of very elabo- rate designs and very durable.
text: PERSIAN CARPETS: Hand made by Persian and Indian natives. The looms are of very simple construction. There are rollers at the top and bottom of the frame, and on these are stretched the threads for the warp or ground. Tufts of coloured woollen yarn are knotted on the warp threads, and over each row of tufts a wool weft is passed and beaten well up for binding. The carpets are very costly, and of very elabo- rate designs and very durable.

Definition: a plain weave cloth with a pattern formed by various warp ends working in twos forming cords. a cotton warp and worsted weft are generally used. also known as the "ottoman cord.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PERSIAN CORDS: A plain weave cloth with a pattern formed by various warp ends working in twos forming cords. A cotton warp and worsted weft are generally used. Also known as the "Ottoman Cord.
text: PERSIAN CORDS: A plain weave cloth with a pattern formed by various warp ends working in twos forming cords. A cotton warp and worsted weft are generally used. Also known as the "Ottoman Cord.

Definition: a variety of brazilian cotton grown in pernambuco. it is of fair staple, but harsh to the feel, and if used alone gives a wiry yarn.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PERMANIS COTTON: A variety of Brazilian cotton grown in Pernambuco. It is of fair staple, but harsh to the feel, and if used alone gives a wiry yarn.
text: PERMANIS COTTON: A variety of Brazilian cotton grown in Pernambuco. It is of fair staple, but harsh to the feel, and if used alone gives a wiry yarn.

Definition: a cloth much used for table covers. about 66 to 72 inches wide, made from heavy linen yarns dyed in dark shades of red, blue, brown, etc. woven plain, but em- broidered afterwards. of peruvian manufacture.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PERUVIAN CLOTH: A cloth much used for table covers. About 66 to 72 inches wide, made from heavy linen yarns dyed in dark shades of red, blue, brown, etc. Woven plain, but em- broidered afterwards. Of Peruvian manufacture.
text: PERUVIAN CLOTH: A cloth much used for table covers. About 66 to 72 inches wide, made from heavy linen yarns dyed in dark shades of red, blue, brown, etc. Woven plain, but em- broidered afterwards. Of Peruvian manufacture.

Definition: a variety grown in peru of good staple and both hard and soft nature. best adapted for mixing. the hard variety is known as rough peruvian and the soft as "" "soft peruvian.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PERUVIAN COTTON: A variety grown in Peru of good staple and both hard and soft nature. Best adapted for mixing. The hard variety is known as Rough Peruvian and the soft as "" "Soft Peruvian.
text: PERUVIAN COTTON: A variety grown in Peru of good staple and both hard and soft nature. Best adapted for mixing. The hard variety is known as Rough Peruvian and the soft as "" "Soft Peruvian.

Definition: a heavy woollen overcoating cloth, generally indigo dyed.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PETERSHAM CLOTH: A heavy woollen overcoating cloth, generally indigo dyed.
text: PETERSHAM CLOTH: A heavy woollen overcoating cloth, generally indigo dyed.

Definition: one single thread of weft yarn passing from selvedge to selvedge.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PICK: One single thread of weft yarn passing from selvedge to selvedge.
text: PICK: One single thread of weft yarn passing from selvedge to selvedge.

Definition: this method of picking requires looms with multiple boxes at each side. the term means the weaving of single picks of different colour or different counts of yarn.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PICK-AND-PICK: This method of picking requires looms with multiple boxes at each side. The term means the weaving of single picks of different colour or different counts of yarn.
text: PICK-AND-PICK: This method of picking requires looms with multiple boxes at each side. The term means the weaving of single picks of different colour or different counts of yarn.

Definition: turning back the loom so as to unweave the cloth to find a broken pick, which is removed. this operation is very necessary in many fabrics, such as poplins, piques, repps, many dobby cloths, and brocades, etc.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PICK-FINDING: Turning back the loom so as to unweave the cloth to find a broken pick, which is removed. This operation is very necessary in many fabrics, such as poplins, piques, repps, many dobby cloths, and brocades, etc.
text: PICK-FINDING: Turning back the loom so as to unweave the cloth to find a broken pick, which is removed. This operation is very necessary in many fabrics, such as poplins, piques, repps, many dobby cloths, and brocades, etc.

Definition: the operation of projecting the shuttle from side to side of the loom through the division in the warp threads. this is done by the overpick or underpick motions. the overpick is suitable for quick-running looms, whereas the underpick is best for heavy or slow looms.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PICKING: The operation of projecting the shuttle from side to side of the loom through the division in the warp threads. This is done by the overpick or underpick motions. The overpick is suitable for quick-running looms, whereas the underpick is best for heavy or slow looms.
text: PICKING: The operation of projecting the shuttle from side to side of the loom through the division in the warp threads. This is done by the overpick or underpick motions. The overpick is suitable for quick-running looms, whereas the underpick is best for heavy or slow looms.

Definition: a general term for all cloths in long lengths from about 36 yards upwards.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PIECE-GOODS: A general term for all cloths in long lengths from about 36 yards upwards.
text: PIECE-GOODS: A general term for all cloths in long lengths from about 36 yards upwards.

Definition: a general term applied to velvets, plushes, corduroys, terry cloths, carpets, fustians, etc. the pile is made by weaving loops on the surface of the cloth. when these loops are cut through they form the surface we know as velvet; when left uncut the cloths are such as corduroys, terry towels, etc.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PILE FABRICS: A general term applied to velvets, plushes, corduroys, terry cloths, carpets, fustians, etc. The pile is made by weaving loops on the surface of the cloth. When these loops are cut through they form the surface we know as velvet; when left uncut the cloths are such as corduroys, terry towels, etc.
text: PILE FABRICS: A general term applied to velvets, plushes, corduroys, terry cloths, carpets, fustians, etc. The pile is made by weaving loops on the surface of the cloth. When these loops are cut through they form the surface we know as velvet; when left uncut the cloths are such as corduroys, terry towels, etc.

Definition: a woollen goods term, and given to the indigo blue dyed heavy overcoating cloth used for seamen's coats, etc.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PILOT CLOTH: A woollen goods term, and given to the indigo blue dyed heavy overcoating cloth used for seamen's coats, etc.
text: PILOT CLOTH: A woollen goods term, and given to the indigo blue dyed heavy overcoating cloth used for seamen's coats, etc.

Definition: a fabric made by the natives of manila from threads obtained from the leaves of the pineapple plant. the threads are not spun at all, and are very similar in ap- pearance and characteristics to horsehair when woven.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PINA CLOTH: A fabric made by the natives of Manila from threads obtained from the leaves of the pineapple plant. The threads are not spun at all, and are very similar in ap- pearance and characteristics to horsehair when woven.
text: PINA CLOTH: A fabric made by the natives of Manila from threads obtained from the leaves of the pineapple plant. The threads are not spun at all, and are very similar in ap- pearance and characteristics to horsehair when woven.

Definition: dobby cloths composed of two warps and two wefts. the face warp is lightly weighted, and weaves with its weft in plain order. the other warp is heavily weighted, and stitches through the plain face cloth. the face cloth at the stitching parts is pulled down, and the unstitched rises and forms an embossed-like surface. the second weft is used as a wadding weft, and its purpose is to make the raised figuring more pronounced. the face warp and weft are usually finer than those used for stitching and wadding and in the proportion of 2: 1, such as 2 ends 32's face 1 end 24's back. a popular cloth is made 40 in. 40/45 yds., 100 face 32's super egyptian, 50 back 2/60's super american, 120 face picks 42's super egyptian, and 64 back picks 18's super american. a dobby loom with drop boxes is required when designs up to 16 staves are wanted. figuring of a more elaborate style requires a jacquard. the finer piqu√©s are rather expensive. plaids (see tartans).
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PIQUE: Dobby cloths composed of two warps and two wefts. The face warp is lightly weighted, and weaves with its weft in plain order. The other warp is heavily weighted, and stitches through the plain face cloth. The face cloth at the stitching parts is pulled down, and the unstitched rises and forms an embossed-like surface. The second weft is used as a wadding weft, and its purpose is to make the raised figuring more pronounced. The face warp and weft are usually finer than those used for stitching and wadding and in the proportion of 2: 1, such as 2 ends 32's face 1 end 24's back. A popular cloth is made 40 in. 40/45 yds., 100 face 32's super Egyptian, 50 back 2/60's super American, 120 face picks 42's super Egyptian, and 64 back picks 18's super American. A dobby loom with drop boxes is required when designs up to 16 staves are wanted. Figuring of a more elaborate style requires a jacquard. The finer piqu√©s are rather expensive. PLAIDS (See TARTANS).
text: PIQUE: Dobby cloths composed of two warps and two wefts. The face warp is lightly weighted, and weaves with its weft in plain order. The other warp is heavily weighted, and stitches through the plain face cloth. The face cloth at the stitching parts is pulled down, and the unstitched rises and forms an embossed-like surface. The second weft is used as a wadding weft, and its purpose is to make the raised figuring more pronounced. The face warp and weft are usually finer than those used for stitching and wadding and in the proportion of 2: 1, such as 2 ends 32's face 1 end 24's back. A popular cloth is made 40 in. 40/45 yds., 100 face 32's super Egyptian, 50 back 2/60's super American, 120 face picks 42's super Egyptian, and 64 back picks 18's super American. A dobby loom with drop boxes is required when designs up to 16 staves are wanted. Figuring of a more elaborate style requires a jacquard. The finer piqu√©s are rather expensive. PLAIDS (See TARTANS).

Definition: a cloth in which both warp and weft work over one and under one all through. a plain cloth can be woven on 2 heald shafts. but 4 are generally used to give a more steady shedding and allow a coarser set of healds to be used. a perfect plain cloth has both sets of threads equal, and the number of ends and picks is equal, which also gives equal bending of the threads.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PLAIN CLOTH: A cloth in which both warp and weft work over one and under one all through. A plain cloth can be woven on 2 heald shafts. but 4 are generally used to give a more steady shedding and allow a coarser set of healds to be used. A perfect plain cloth has both sets of threads equal, and the number of ends and picks is equal, which also gives equal bending of the threads.
text: PLAIN CLOTH: A cloth in which both warp and weft work over one and under one all through. A plain cloth can be woven on 2 heald shafts. but 4 are generally used to give a more steady shedding and allow a coarser set of healds to be used. A perfect plain cloth has both sets of threads equal, and the number of ends and picks is equal, which also gives equal bending of the threads.

Definition: the french word for pleated, and is given to fabrics which have a narrow fold formed during weaving, and pro- duced by the nature of the weave. two warps are neces- sary. these cloths are also known as tucks.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PLISSE: The French word for pleated, and is given to fabrics which have a narrow fold formed during weaving, and pro- duced by the nature of the weave. Two warps are neces- sary. These cloths are also known as Tucks.
text: PLISSE: The French word for pleated, and is given to fabrics which have a narrow fold formed during weaving, and pro- duced by the nature of the weave. Two warps are neces- sary. These cloths are also known as Tucks.

Definition: a light muslin cloth of very good quality and close plain weave, with small figures of many-coloured yarns, produced on swivel looms.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PLUMETIS: A light muslin cloth of very good quality and close plain weave, with small figures of many-coloured yarns, produced on swivel looms.

Definition: this is the best of the pile fabrics, and has a pile of silk with a super cotton back. it is usually a weft pile cloth.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PLUSH: This is the best of the pile fabrics, and has a pile of silk with a super cotton back. It is usually a weft pile cloth.
text: PLUSH: This is the best of the pile fabrics, and has a pile of silk with a super cotton back. It is usually a weft pile cloth.

Definition: this is an ordinary velveteen cloth with a longer pile, and is made in imitation of the real plush. all cotton is used.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PLUSH VELVETEEN: This is an ordinary velveteen cloth with a longer pile, and is made in imitation of the real plush. All cotton is used.

Definition: a very good quality cotton cloth intended for pockets, but used for many domestic purposes. usually 2 x 2 twill weave in a fine reed, and made from super yarns. as a rule the cloth is sold in the loom state or with a soft finish. about 36 in. 100 yards, 120 √ó 80, 36's/40's.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis

As a rule the cloth is sold in the loom state or with a soft finish. About 36 in. 100 yards, 120 √ó 80, 36's/40's.

Definition: a french made cloth woven from a fine dyed spun silk warp and angora weft, plain weave, soft finish. used for dress purposes. the english imitation has a cotton warp and is made in the yorkshire district.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: POILE DE CHEVRE: A French made cloth woven from a fine dyed spun silk warp and angora weft, plain weave, soft finish. Used for dress purposes. The English imitation has a cotton warp and is made in the Yorkshire district.
text: POILE DE CHEVRE: A French made cloth woven from a fine dyed spun silk warp and angora weft, plain weave, soft finish. Used for dress purposes. The English imitation has a cotton warp and is made in the Yorkshire district.

Definition: astrakan cloths with the loops cut.

Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: POLARIANS: Astrakan cloths with the loops cut.

Definition: a designer's term used in the silk trade for small floral effects, generally in a dark crimson colouring.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: POMPADOUR: A designer's term used in the silk trade for small floral effects, generally in a dark crimson colouring.
text: POMPADOUR: A designer's term used in the silk trade for small floral effects, generally in a dark crimson colouring.

Definition: a yorkshire made cloth with a heavy cotton warp and a heavy wool weft. made in 56 inch and wider, with a wide coloured wool selvedge. cross dyed and well finished plain or twill weaves. a style of melton cloth.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PONCHO CLOTH: A Yorkshire made cloth with a heavy cotton warp and a heavy wool weft. Made in 56 inch and wider, with a wide coloured wool selvedge. Cross dyed and well finished plain or twill weaves. A style of melton cloth.
text: PONCHO CLOTH: A Yorkshire made cloth with a heavy cotton warp and a heavy wool weft. Made in 56 inch and wider, with a wide coloured wool selvedge. Cross dyed and well finished plain or twill weaves. A style of melton cloth.

Definition: the real irish poplin is a plain weave cloth, fine silk warp, coarser worsted weft which forms a rib effect. the lancashire poplins are made from all cotton of super qualities, such as 28 in. 60 yds., 144 x 28. 32's/10's, or 164 √ó 58, 2/72's/2/50's.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis

Definition: a shedding motion that both raises and sinks the heald shafts, such as woodcroft's tappet.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: POSITIVE SHEDDING: A shedding motion that both raises and sinks the heald shafts, such as Woodcroft's tappet.
text: POSITIVE SHEDDING: A shedding motion that both raises and sinks the heald shafts, such as Woodcroft's tappet.

Definition: plain weave cotton cloths used for printing, made in many widths and qualities from pure yarns. there are two general classes, burnley printers and cheshire printers. fair samples of each are:- burnley-32 in./116's, 16 √ó 16, 36/40. cheshire 36 in./80's, 19 x 22, 36/40. the cheshire cloth is the better cloth in every respect.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PRINTERS: Plain weave cotton cloths used for printing, made in many widths and qualities from pure yarns. There are two general classes, Burnley printers and Cheshire printers. Fair samples of each are:- Burnley-32 in./116's, 16 √ó 16, 36/40. Cheshire 36 in./80's, 19 x 22, 36/40. The Cheshire cloth is the better cloth in every respect.

Definition: the ordinary 2 x 1 warp twill weave.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PRUNELLE TWILL: The ordinary 2 x 1 warp twill weave.

Definition: a light weight yorkshire woollen cloth, generally with the prunelle twill weave; used for dress purposes.
Title: Glossary of textile terms
Author: H.P. Curtis
Combined: PRUNELLA: A light weight Yorkshire woollen cloth, generally with the prunelle twill weave; used for dress purposes.
